intro: Diodia dasycephala, commonly known as roughhead dillies, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Diodia dasycephala is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
